channel.title: dotfiles on ANDREFFS
channel.description: Recent content in dotfiles on ANDREFFS

item.title: Just keep on "Save for later"
item.description: Since this #remotelife began, sadly not for the best reasons, I’ve been able to finally clean my backlog of, guess what, TV Shows, Games, Podcasts, Books… Well, everything that a person is suppose to do! Very happy was I until I remembered that, maybe I should start looking into the “To Read” bookmarks, “Saved” on Reddit and, the holy grail, “Read Later” of Feedly. While the “Saved” section on Reddit was mostly threads from /r/cscarrearquestions (and some memes from /r/wsb ðŸ˜‚) the other two places were actual interesting articles that I have planned on reading.

item.title: I Really Like Emoji's
item.description: I came across a blogpost that explained how to add emoji’s to your terminal prompt, something like this: The post is pretty good! Not only explains how to add emoji’s to you prompt, but also goes a bit further on how to $RANDOM an emoji from a list of them, and bash formatting (customize the text in your terminal with colors and such). Although I’m pretty happy with my terminal setup (shameless plug to ðŸ‘‰ my dotfilesðŸ‘ˆ ), I kept coming back to this idea.
